content: Act as a helpful AI assistant
In Julia, Write a function `keep_only_names` which iterates over the provided list of words (`words`) and removes all words that do not start with a capital letter (eg, remove "dog" but keep "Dog").

Here is an example of how to write this function in Julia:
```julia
function keep_only_names(words)
    # Initialize the new list to hold words that start with a capital letter.
    new_list = String[]

    # Iterate over each word in the provided list.
    for word in words
        # Check if the first character of the word is uppercase (A-Z).
        if uppercase(word[1]) == word[1]
            # If it is, append the word to the new_list.
            push!(new_list, word)
        end
    end

    return new_list
end
```
Here are some example inputs and outputs:
```julia
words = ["Hello", "world", "John"]
filtered_words = keep_only_names(words)
println(filtered_words)  # Prints ["Hello", "John"]
```
In this function, we iterate over each word in the provided list and check if the first character of that word is uppercase. If it is, we append the word to a new list, which will contain only words starting with an uppercase letter. We then return this new list as our result.
